page.title: 14Recent events on Papa Stour.
page.content: The most tragic event of recent years was the sinking of the Papa Stour mailboat in October 1981.The{Venture} sank with the loss of one life during a North Easterly gale.The{Venture}used to go back and forth between Papa and Sandness through the Papa Sound, bringing provisions for the shop, as well as the mail. Now a 34 feet long fishing boat chartered by the Shetland Islands Council runs a greater distance from Burra-firth across ST Magnus Bay. The{Ivy Leaf}is mainland based,and the pier there has been greatly improved. Four years previously an Aberdeen based trawler the{Eleanor Viking}ran aground on the notorious Ve Skerries 3 miles North West of Papa Stour . Since then an automatic light house has been installed on the skerries,as a warning to shipping.
